comments:
Hi,
I just downloaded eclipse-SDK-20020416-linux-gtk1x.zip but get the following
stacktrace when trying to execute eclipse. 

[thomasvl@thomasvl eclipse]$ ./eclipse
Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/swt/widgets/Widget
        at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Native Method)
        at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Class.java:237)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginDescriptor.createExecutableExtension(PluginDescriptor.java:136)
       at
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.PluginDescriptor.createExecutableExtension(PluginDescriptor.java:165)
       at
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.ConfigurationElement.createExecutableExtension(ConfigurationElement.java:96)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.loaderGetRunnable(InternalPlatform.java:469)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.getRunnable(InternalBootLoader.java:448)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:773)
        at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:319)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:190)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:549)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:390)

Above error also occurs when trying to execute eclipse with ./eclipse -ws gtk1x.

Have a missed something (e.g. do I need to append something to my classpath)?

Cheers,
Thomas 


Platform details:
OS: Mandrake 8.1

java -version
java version 1.3.1_02

[thomasvl@thomasvl eclipse]$ rpm -qa |grep gtk

rpm -qa |grep gdk
gdk-pixbuf-0.16.0-5.ximian.1
gdk-pixbuf-xlib-0.16.0-5.ximian.1

gdk-pixbuf-loaders-0.16.0-5.ximian.1
gdk-pixbuf-devel-0.16.0-5.ximian.1

The classpath pointing to the SWT classes gets created dynamically by Eclipse 
Core, so you don't have to set it yourself.

Your stack trace does indicate that the whole swt.jar can not be found.  Can 
you verify that your eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.swt/ws/gtk1x/ contains the swt 
jar?

Boris,
eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.swt/ws/gtk1x/ contains the following files:
swt.jar  swt.jar.bin.log  swt-pi.jar  swt-pi.jar.bin.log  swt-pisrc.zip  swtsrc.zip

However I think the dynamic classpath generation might be broken, since it seams
to work when executing eclipse with  ./eclipse -cp
plugins/org.eclipse.swt/ws/gtk1x/swt.jar (Not sure if this is a valid option but
it works).

Hmm... strange.  This is not happening on my machine.  I'll go talk to the guys 
who do the dynamic classpath, and get back to you when I figure the cause out.
SWT on GTK1.x is not supported and no work will be done on it.
